column1: Des Plaines  is a city in Cook County
column2: Illinois
column3: United States. Its population was 58
column4: 364 at the 2010 census. The city is a suburb of Chicago and is located just north of O'Hare International Airport. It is situated on and is named after the Des Plaines River
column5: which runs through the city just east of its downtown area.

column2: Ottawa
column3: and Ojibwe (Chippewa) Native American tribes inhabited the Des Plaines River Valley prior to Europeans' arrival. When French explorers and missionaries arrived in the 1600s in what was then the Illinois Country of New France
column4: they named the waterway La Rivière des Plaines (English translation: "River of the Plane Tree") as they felt that trees on the river resembled the European plane trees. The first white settlers came from the eastern United States in 1833
column6: followed by many German immigrants during the 1840s and '50s. In the 1850s
column7: the land in this area was purchased by the Illinois and Wisconsin Land Company along a railroad line planned between Chicago and Janesville
column9: the developers built a steam-powered mill next to the river to cut local trees into railroad ties. Socrates Rand then bought the mill and converted it into a grist mill
column10: which attracted local farmers. The Illinois and Wisconsin Railroad made its first stop in the area in the fall of 1854.In 1857
column13: and Fond du Lac Railroad began running its route
column14: stopping near the mill on the Des Plaines river
column15: where a small business section had grown up. The railroad platted the prospective town of Rand at the site. In 1859
column16: the Chicago and North Western Railway purchased the rail line
column17: giving the train station the name "Des Plaines".  In 1869
column18: the Rand subdivision's name was changed to Des Plaines
column19: and the village of Des Plaines was then incorporated.Des Plaines was reincorporated in 1873 and elected a village board the following year. Local brick manufacturer Franklin Whitcomb served as the first Village President.In 1925
column20: village residents voted to convert to a city form of government and annexed the village of Riverview to the south. Subsequent annexations included the Orchard Place area in 1956. The city experienced rapid growth after World War II and with the opening of nearby Chicago-O'Hare International Airport.Des Plaines was the site of Ray Kroc's first McDonald's franchise
column21: which opened in 1955.  The restaurant was demolished in 1984
column22: and a replica was built on the site as a museum dedicated to McDonald's history.  In 2017
column23: McDonald's announced plans to demolish the building due to repeated flooding. The building has since been demolished.

column2: Des Plaines was the site of the accident of American Airlines Flight 191
column3: in which a McDonnell Douglas DC-10 departing from O'Hare lost an engine and wing material and crashed near a local trailer park just north of Touhy Avenue. All 271 people on board the aircraft died
column4: as did two workers at a repair garage. Two more

column3: Des Plaines has a total area of 14.415 square miles (37.33 km2)
column4: of which 14.28 square miles (36.99 km2) (or 99.06%) is land and 0.135 square miles (0.35 km2) (or 0.94%) is water.Des Plaines is traversed by two interstate highways – I-90 (the Northwest Tollway) and I-294 (the Tri-State Tollway).

column1: Des Plaines is named for the Des Plaines River
column2: which flows through it.  The name is from 18th-century French referencing the American sycamore  which resembles the European plane tree.

column1: Portions of Des Plaines are underlain by the "Des Plaines Disturbance"
column2: an area in which the layers of sedimentary rock are highly abnormal. This probably represents an ancient meteorite crater
column3: 75 to 200 feet (23 to 61 m) beneath the town. The bedrock was highly fractured by the impact
column4: with large blocks of sediment upended. The crater was eventually filled by glacial activity
column5: so that no trace now remains on the surface.Addresses in the city limits of Des Plaines have their own numbering system. Areas in unincorporated Maine Township have Des Plaines postal addresses that follow the Chicago numbering system. Devon Avenue in Des Plaines is 3200 South
column6: while it is 6400 North in Chicago. Golf Road runs through a large unincorporated area as 9600 North with a Des Plaines mailing address but is 0 North/South when entering the Des Plaines city limits. As sections become incorporated
column7: they take on the city numbering system. For instance in 2003
column12: when it was formally incorporated into the city limits.  The largest unincorporated areas are in the O'Hare area and east of the Tri-State Tollway.

column1: A notable amount of Cook County residents reside in unincorporated areas which use a Des Plaines zip code.  These areas are densely populated and consist primarily of high density
column2: multi-family housing with a very high percentage of foreign born residents.  In the 2000 census the population of these unincorporated areas of Cook County assigned Des Plaines zip codes was 25
column3: 617. This unincorporated area has never been a part of the city of Des Plaines
column4: and the majority of this area is separated from the actual city of Des Plaines by a belt of Forest Preserve lands and a Tollway barrier created by I-294.
